newsitem.title: SENEGAL: Senegal calls tenders for phosphate firm.
newsitem.headline: Senegal calls tenders for phosphate firm.

text.p: Senegal has launched an international tender for the sale of its 50 percent stake in the Societe Senegalaise des Phosphates de Thies, the controller of the state's portofolio said on Tuesday.
"The 50 percent which represents the entire state stake in the company, will be sold to the chosen candidate," Ahmadou Camara told Reuters.

Tenders close on February 14, 1997 and should be addressed to: Secretariat de la Cellule de Gestion et de Controle de portefeuille de l'Etat. Immeuble Electra II, 3-eme etage, 11 rue Malan, Dakar, fax (221) 22 56 31, phone (221) 233428 or 232429.
Camara said the company, which employs 205 people, made a net profit of 200 million CFA francs in 1996. Its turnover in 1995 was 2,601 billion CFA.
